edu.cpp.cs.cs141.spyvsninjaassasins

Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.spyvsninjaassasins.GameBoard

  • public class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    AAnthony This class is in charge of keeping and controlling any changes made to the GameBoard. It holds all of the spawned MapObjects in a 2-D array, size 9 x 9.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameBoard

        public GameBoard()

    • Method Detail

      • generateBoard

        public void generateBoard(int enemies)
        This method generates a new board with the player in the bottom right, 5 randomly spawned in enemies, 3 randomly spawned power-ups, and 1 briefcase spawned in 1 of the 9 rooms. Also sets the initial field of view for the player.

      • generateBoard

        public void generateBoard(int enemies,
                          int lives)
        Alt generateBoard method: used when the player must be spawned with a specific amount of lives (IE. during loading a file or when the player must be respawned after death).

      • spawnPlayer

        public void spawnPlayer(Player player)
        Spawns a player argument in the lower left corner spawn point.

      • deleteBoard

        public void deleteBoard()
        Nullifies all spots on the grid, so as to let the program generate a new board without error.

      • saveBoard

        public Data saveBoard(Data saveData)
        Takes in a Data object argument and runs through the board to save the various elements that will be used again when loading the board. This includes the player's row, column, lives, bullets, etc.

      • loadBoard

        public void loadBoard(Data d)
        Takes the Data object passed into the d parameter and generates the board based on the fields of the Data object.

      • movePlayer

        public boolean movePlayer(char direction)
        This method is in charge of moving the player based on the direction the user inputted in the UI. Throughout the process of the method, it deletes the current field of view, moves the player to its new space (if applicable) and creates the new field of view.

      • createFieldOfView

        public void createFieldOfView()
        Sets the objects in the spaces to the player's immediate up, down, left, and right to visible.

      • moveEnemies

        public void moveEnemies(boolean hardMode)
        This is the main method in charge of moving the enemies. Runs through the board by each row, left to right, and moves any unmoved enemies. If a valid move does not exist for that enemy, then the code skips over said enemy, to avoid crashing the game.

      • lowerShieldCounter

        public void lowerShieldCounter()
        At the end of every turn, this method lowers the player's shield counter by one.

      • shoot

        public java.lang.String shoot(char direction)
        Method in charge of firing the player's gun in the specified direction.

      • disposeOfBodies

        public void disposeOfBodies()
        If any enemies were set to be dead (alive = false), then they are erased from the board.

      • moveEnemyFromSpawn

        public void moveEnemyFromSpawn()
        If the enemy is on the player's spawn point during the time of death or being unstuck, it is moved.

      • debugVisibility

        public void debugVisibility()
        Sets all objects on the board to visible and sets the room with the briefcase to located, so the player can see everything on the board.

      • undoDebugVisibility

        public void undoDebugVisibility()
        The opposite of the above method. Used to hide all that were hidden before activating debug. If the locator has been found, the briefcase room will remain located.

      • setDebugPlayer

        public void setDebugPlayer()
        Find the player on the board and gives him/her the proper amount of bullets for debug mode.

      • undoDebugPlayer

        public void undoDebugPlayer(int row,
                            int col,
                            char direction,
                            int bullets,
                            int lives)
        When the player exits debug mode, this method undoes any changes and reverts the player back to the state he/she was in before debug was activated. However, the row and column (the position of the player) will not change in the undo process; he/she will stay in whatever spot he/she is currently in.

      • unstuck

        public void unstuck()
        Method used to get the player out if enemies trap him/her, eliminating any valid moves. The player will be spawned back at the start with one less life. Enemies will also be moved if in the way to avoid consecutive deaths/stuck situations.

      • scanFor

        public boolean scanFor(java.lang.String type)
        Scans through the board looking for an object of whatever String argument is passed for the type parameter. If found, the method returns true; otherwise, it returns false.

      • checkExists

        public boolean checkExists(int i,
                           int j)
        Checks if an object exists in grid[i][j].

      • checkForRooms

        public boolean checkForRooms(int i,
                             int j)
        Used in the process of looking to make sure a room is not in the way of the player's line of sight.

      • checkWin

        public boolean checkWin()
        Checks if the briefcase is still on the board. If the player is occupying the space where the briefcase is, then the player logically has beaten the level, and thus the method will return true. Therefore, if the method can find any instance in the board that is of type Briefcase or is a room that has the briefcase, then the player has not won, and the method will return false.

      • enemyIsVisible

        public boolean enemyIsVisible()
        Scans the board and checks if there is at least one visible enemy.

      • enemyCount

        public int enemyCount()
        Scans the board to count how many enemies there are. Used when generating the Data object to save the game.

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()
        Finds the player on the board and returns said Player object.

      • getBullets

        public int getBullets()

      • getLives

        public int getLives()

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType(int i,
                                int j)

      • getUnit

        public MapObjects getUnit(int row,
                          int col)

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible(int i,
                         int j)

      • setVisibility

        public void setVisibility(int row,
                          int column,
                          boolean visible)
        Sets the visibility of an object on the board, based on whether or not the user can see it.

      • setInvincibility

        public void setInvincibility(boolean on)
